result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A Curler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $4,639.54 and restitution surcharge. Restitution is Joint and Several with co-actors : Michael Kraft 15CF62, Jeremy Thomas 15CF46, Drevon Grant 15CF41.
---------------------------------------

Pay court costs. If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
DOC COLLECT
---------------------------------------

No alcohol. No drugs or drug paraphernalia. No prescription medication without a valid prescription. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. No contact with Jonah Marker. No contact with co-actors or the victims.
---------------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------------------
Undergo any recommended evaluations or treatment and follow through with any recommendations of Agent.
---------------------------------------

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jacob A Curler
Current: 100 Corrections Drive - #559882, c/o Stanley Correctional Institution, Stanley, WI 54768-6500 United States  (Effective: 02-13-2019)
Prior: W4140 Woodview Trc, East Troy, WI 53120
Temporary Commitment form filed
BOND QUASHED

8:43 am  Court in session.  Cases called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Jacob A Curler in court, in custody with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy.  
Matter is before the court for a sentencing hearing on case 15CF96 and sentencing after revocation hearing on 13CF521.  
The victims from the armed robbery case are present.  Discussion between Court & Attys with regard to victim notification in 13CF521.  
A message was left with the victim in file 13CF521 notifying her of the change in time for this hearing from 9:00 am to 8:30 am.  
Court notes that the victim in that case did not appear at the previously scheduled sentencing date of May 3rd.  
Atty Murphy has reviewed the sentencing materials.  
State will cap recommendation on 15CF96 at 9 yrs IC and 7 yrs ES.    
There is no agreement as to sentence on file 13CF521.  
Victims do not wish to make a statement.  Court did review statements they made to PSI writer.  
8:47 am  Argument as to sentence / sentencing after revocation by Atty Johnson.  
8:59 am  Argument as to sentence / sentencing after revocation by Atty Murphy.  
Atty Murphy indicates there are 704 days of sentence credit on file 13CF521.  
9:08 am  Defendant's mother, Margaret A. Curler, makes statement on behalf of her son.  
9:15 am  Statement by defendant.  Deft apologizes to his mother and to the victims.  
9:17 am  Court makes record and sentences defendant on files 15CF96 & 13CF521.  

SENTENCE on 13CF521 (SEHR):  
Total length of sentence is Six (6) years:  3 yrs IC & 3 yrs ES;
Consec. to any other sentence defendant may be serving;  
Sentence credit:  712 days;  
NOT eligible for CIP or SAP on file 13CF521;

SENTENCE on 15CF96 (SEH):  
Total length of sentence is Sixteen (16) years:  9 yrs IC & 7 yrs ES;
Consec. to sentence on 13CF521;  
IS ELIGIBLE for CIP and SAP on file 15CF96;  

CONDITIONS OF ES on both files:  
1)  Pay court costs.  
2)  Pay restitution in the amount of $4639.54, joint & several with co-actors.  
3)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
4)  Maintain employment.  
5)  No alcohol.  No drugs or drug paraphernalia.  No prescription medication without a valid prescription.  
6)  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.  
7)  No weapons.  
8)  No contact with the co-actors or the victims.  
9)  No contact with Jonah Marker.  
10)  Undergo any recommended evaluations or treatment and follow through with any recommendations of Agent.  
9:36 am  Court in recess.

11:06 am  Court in session.  Appearances given.  Cases called.  
Deft Jacob A Curler in court, in custody with Atty Michael Shannon Murphy.  
ADA Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court makes record as to charges / penalties in both the SEHR file, 13CF521 & in the SEH file, 15CF96.  
Court has reviewed revocation summary in file 13CF521 and updated PSI in 15CF96 which now includes victim statements.  
Court makes record with regard to responses made by Atty Murphy at the time of the plea hearing and statements made by defendant in the PSI that has been filed.  
Court is going to take a recess so defendant can discuss this issue with Atty Murphy.  
11:14 am  Response by Atty Donohoo.  State is not agreeing to any plea withdrawal.  
11:15 am  Response by Court.  Further response by Atty Donohoo.  
11:16 am  Atty Murphy makes record that he has discussed the issues with his client and he does not believe deft is wishing to withdraw his plea.  Atty Murphy makes further record as to issues relating to whether there was an agreement for concurrent sentences.  He is requesting a brief continuance to meet with ADA Johnson.  
11:19 am  Court in recess.  
11:28 am  Court in session.  Same appearances.  Defendant is prepared to affirm his guilt today and is not asking to withdraw his guilty plea. 
11:28 am  Atty Murphy makes record with Mr. Curler in support of the factual basis.  Defendant states he plead because he is guilty.  Court is satisfied.  Atty Donohoo is satisfied with the record made and asks that sentencing go forward.  Discussion concerning proceeding with sentencing today or continuing to a new sentencing date.  
11:31 am  Court makes record that victims are present today and notes this has been pending for years now.  Court expresses it's concerns with proceeding today and believes it is appropriate to grant the continuance requested by the defense so they will have an opportunity to speak with ADA Johnson.  
11:37 am  Court in recess.  
Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2018 at 09:00 am.
Updated
E-mails between Attys and Court re:  PSI // sentencing hearing
Amended including dismissed and read-in cases
Amended w/ correct due date for report of 04/19/18

Defendant Jacob A Curler in court, in custody with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 3:30 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing. Record by Atty. Murphy as to agreement of the parties. Response by ADA Johnson that record of Atty. Murphy is correct.  Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. 
Deportation warning given to defendant
DEFENDANT PLEADS GUILTY TO COUNT #1.
COUNTS #2 - 4 ARE DISMISSED AND READ-IN
Court finds defendant enters his pleas knowingling and voluntarily, and intelligently and finds the Defendant guilty. 
PSI ordered and matter set for setnencing.
Court in recess @ 3:40 p.m.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 3, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Court will give the Attys until Thursday at 1:15 pm to enter change of plea.  
Plea hearing scheduled for December 7, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

2:30 PM FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob A Curler in court with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy.  Attorney Murphy has filed a Motion to adjourn the jury trial.  Atty Murphy makes record as to the reasons for his request.  Due to the volume of the discovery, he doesn't feel like he is prepared to proceed to trial on Monday.  He's not even sure that he has all of the discovery from defendant's prior counsel.  Response by Attorney Johnson that she is aware of the volume of the discovery and believes there are items that Atty Murphy may not have.  The victims are present in court and Attorney Johnson had a chance to meet with them.  The victims are ok with this matter being continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 27, 2017 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacob A Curler in court, in custody with attorney Peter Wilson.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant wishes to waive his preliminary hearing. Court goes over waiver form with the defendant. Information filed - reading waived. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.L. OR A.F. OR M.F.    Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTORS JEREMEY THOMAS OR DREVON GRANT OR MICHAEL KRAFT. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
